intro: Gamocarpha poeppigii, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk. Gamocarpha poeppigii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
